title: Lisa Wilkinson's shock farting admission on The Project
text:
In the TV industry, there's a saying that you should never work with animals or children.

Lisa Wilkinson, 59, found that out the hard way while interviewing Erin, a mum who discovered she was pregnant 24 hours before giving birth on The Sunday Project.

In the clip, Erin is pushing her son, four-year-old Andrew on a swing.

'It's not the first time': The Project's Lisa Wilkinson made a bizarre farting admission on Sunday, after a TV interview with Andrew, 4, (pictured) took an awkward turn

Lisa asked if Erin was excited about the impending birth of her next child.

Before anyone could answer, Andrew pipped up: 'Even I'm excited!'

Lisa jokingly told the youngster she wanted to hear what his dad had to say.

Cheeky: The former Today host asked the youngsters' parents if they were excited about their new baby, but it was Andrew who stole the show telling Lisa he farted on her

But cheeky Andrew had other plans, telling The Project host: 'I farted on you,' leading her to burst out in laughter while his parents looked embarrassed.

Once the interview wrapped, co-host Tommy Little questioned if that was the first time she had been farted on during a story.

She laughed, responding: 'It's not the first time I've been farted on by a boy, that's for sure,' the former Today host said.

Tough question: Once the interview wrapped, co-host Tommy Little (left) questioned if that was the first time she had been farted on during a story, to which she replied: 'It's not the first time I've been farted on by a boy. I have two sons'

She added: 'I have two sons of my own.'

The TV presenter has been married to journalist Peter FitzSimons for 27 years.

The pair wed on September 26, 1992, and they have three children - two sons, Billi and Jake, and daughter Louis FitzSimons.
description: In the TV industry, there's a saying that you should never work with animals or children.
